definition: to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: Eg: The police descended on their hide-out.
sentences.chinese: 警察突然襲擊了他們的藏身處。

sentences.english: Perhaps the king used this as a hiding-place.
sentences.chinese: 或許國王用這裏做一個藏身處。

sentences.english: The escaped prisoner was dragged (out) from his hiding-place.
sentences.chinese: 那逃犯從藏身處被拖了出來。

sentences.english: Go to a prince, the king of jin from the burrow came out.
sentences.chinese: 待太子一走，晉王從藏身處走出來。

sentences.english: A woodcock flushed from its cover.
sentences.chinese: 一隻蘭鷸從藏身處驚飛而起。

sentences.english: Sheep passed by near his hiding place, and the Wolf called to him.
sentences.chinese: 一隻羊從他的藏身處經過，於是狼叫住了羊。

sentences.english: their hide-and-seek hiding spots were too small.
sentences.chinese: 他們的捉迷藏藏身處太小了。

sentences.english: Do safe havens exist on both sides of the border?
sentences.chinese: 巴阿邊境兩側都有他們的藏身處嗎？

sentences.english: When they got to their forest hide-out they divided up the loot.
sentences.chinese: 他們回到森林裏的藏身處分贓。
